events.message: The customer reported a car collision that occurred on the morning of April 1st, requesting to file a claim immediately for the damages sustained.
The claim was categorized under auto accident following customer’s description of the vehicle collision with another car at an intersection.
Assignment of a claims agent to handle the case was completed, ensuring specialized support for the auto accident claim process.
The insurer sent an acknowledgment to the customer confirming receipt of the auto accident claim and providing next steps.
The agent requested the customer to submit accident photographs, police report, and vehicle repair estimates to proceed with the investigation.
Customer provided all requested documents including photos of vehicle damage and official police report to support the auto accident claim.
The investigation into the circumstances of the car collision began with inspection of the submitted documents and accident details.
The investigation concluded that the customer's vehicle was impacted by another driver who ran a red light, as documented in the police report.
A settlement offer covering the vehicle repair costs and rental reimbursement was proposed to the customer after claim evaluation.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and appreciated the support received during the claims process.
Approval for the full settlement amount was granted to the customer following confirmation of agreement on the proposed payout.
The settlement payment was issued to the customer’s bank account to cover the auto repair expenses and related losses.
The claim was officially closed after successful payment issuance and confirmation that the repairs were underway at the authorized shop.
All records related to the customer’s auto accident claim have been archived in the insurer’s system for any future reference.
